moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 d6:
the phillidor.
I dont think its that good that black should play it...
moves.3. Bc4 Be6 4. Bxe6 fxe6: black takes control of the center (can play d5) but is ruining his king side pawn structure)
moves.5. d3 Nd7 6. Nc3 a6: why? there's nothing to be afraid of with Nb5...
moves.7... Qf6: there is no point in playing 0-0-0 due to white's Bg5. maybe Ngf6-Be7 and 0-0 is better.
moves.8. Bg5 Qf7 9. h3: I think that better was Nd2 with f4.
moves.9... h6 10. Bh4 g5 11. Bg3: black is attacking in the kingside with no pieces and only with pawns. it cant be that good.
moves.11... Ngf6 12. a3 Nh5 13. d4: correct! there's nothing to be afraid of with Nxg3. breaking through the center is the right thing to do.
moves.13... Nxg3 14. fxg3 exd4 15. Nxd4: now we see the weakness of black's queens.
moves.17... e5 18. Nd5: no way for the black queen to hide. the mate is near...
